alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 02 at 8:07AM MDT until June 02 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of east central New Mexico, including the following counties, Curry County, Quay County and Roosevelt County. * WHEN...From Noon MDT today through this evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered-to-numerous showers and thunderstorms will develop this afternoon, then isolated showers and thunderstorms may linger into the early evening. Stronger storms will be capable of producing rain at a rate around 1 inch per hour. Where the ground is still saturated from heavy rainfall over recent days, rain at this rate will be capable of producing flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Curry County; Quay County; Roosevelt County
